alert.note: Alert for City of Falls Church (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:04PM EDT until July 29 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA...ANNE ARUNDEL...SOUTH CENTRAL MONTGOMERY...CENTRAL PRINCE GEORGES...ARLINGTON AND EAST CENTRAL FAIRFAX COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF FALLS CHURCH... At 503 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Pinehurst to near Crofton to Anacostia, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Arlington, Bethesda, Bowie, Severn, Annapolis, College Park, Crofton, Greenbelt, Langley Park, Beltsville, Riviera Beach, Forestville, Falls Church, Largo, Coral Hills, Bladensburg, Mayo, Pimmit Hills, Shady Side and Deale. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia.
